'''Gostir''' was the name of one of the [[Dragons]] of [[Morgoth]],<ref name=gostir>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entries "GOS-, GOTH-"</ref> about whom almost nothing is known except that they possessed a dragon-name<ref name=gostir/> which had evolved from the older name ''Gorsthir''.<ref name=gorsthir>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "THĒ-"</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Gostir'' means "dread-glance" in [[Noldorin]], from ''gost'' ("dread, terror")<ref name=gostir/> and ''thîr'' ("look, face, expression, countenance"), as well as the root ''THĒ'', meaning "look (see or seem)".<ref name=gorsthir/>

[[File:Jack Dullahan - Gostir (dread glance).jpg|thumb|250px|''Gostir (dread glance)'' by [[:Category:Images by Jack Dullahan|Jack Dullahan]]]]

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
=== ''Middle-earth Role Playing'' ===
:Gostir appears as a white [[Cold-drakes|Cold-drake]] with red eyes who dwells north of [[Rhûn]] in Barl Syrnac in the ''Creatures of Middle-earth'' supplement of ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]''. Gostir was said to be the older brother of [[Lhamthanc]].
